crusader.title: Crusader
crusader.name: Reynauld
crusader.description: Once a simple farmer who joined the war to save his family from famine, Reynauld rose unexpectedly through martial prowess to become a legendary commander. The horrors he witnessed and his own transformation into a hardened warrior left him unable to return to his former life. His peculiar habit of collecting trinkets from fallen enemies and his distinctive whistling became well-known among his men. Now drawn to the Estate, he seeks not holy war but a deeper purpose in combating forces that threaten the very fabric of humanity.
crusader.history: Born to till the soil, Reynauld lived a peaceful life with his wife and young son until famine threatened their survival. He joined the army as a conscript, leaving behind promises of return. His natural leadership and battlefield courage saw him rise from farmer to feared commander. In a pivotal moment, he spared The Warlord, recognizing the futility of endless conflict. This act, coupled with his growing disillusionment, led him to abandon both the war and thoughts of returning home, knowing he could no longer fit into that simple life.
crusader.summary: A stalwart and inspiring former farmer turned legendary Crusader, haunted by war, who struggles with kleptomanic tendencies and a conflicted past.

status.description: Vigilant beneath the Ancestor's statue, spiritually unsettled by the stone eyes that seem to watch with hungry patience

clothing.head: Steel helm
clothing.accessories: Purple tunic with a white cross

crusader.magic: The light, a divine power that lets him smite foes and heal allies
notes: Has kleptomanic tendencies that he tries to hide
Does a characteristic whistle when pleased with himself
Speaks with archaic formality - uses 'ye,' 'thou,' 'thee,' 'wherefore' in speech
Quietly distrustful of pagans who reject the Light
Wears simple farmer's clothes when out of his armor
Senses spiritual weight in corrupted places
Senses wrongness in the Estate's surrounding lands
Pockets trinkets from fallen enemies with practiced sleight of hand
Deeply unsettled by the Caretaker's madness and cryptic warnings
Senses malevolent awareness in the Ancestor's statue

heiress.description: The crusader maintains a professional relationship with the heiress, focusing on fulfilling his role as her protector with a devout sense of duty.

kheir.description: The Crusader has pledged to protect the Heir despite obvious doubts about his fitness for the trials ahead. He sees a frightened scholar where leadership is needed, but duty demands he try.

highwayman.description: The wordless synchronization between them in detecting the ambush confirms a kinship forged in violence—two men who read the same danger signs and move to counter them without needing to speak, their shared martial instincts creating seamless tactical partnership.

seraph.description: The Crusader served under the Seraph after her miraculous transformation, awed by her divine presence and inspired by her holy purpose. Her burned visage and manifest powers were proof of the Light's grace, making his role in her crusade feel truly righteous.

highwayman.title: Highwayman
highwayman.name: Dismas
highwayman.description: Once a prisoner, the Highwayman is now a haunted fugitive, living off the squalor of the city's canals and the meager pickings from vermin. His vision of freedom has been replaced by a reality of degradation, driving him to reluctantly offer his services for a final, desperate heist. Now, his path has unexpectedly converged with that of the Heiress and the Heir, offering a precarious chance at redemption through service.
highwayman.history: The Highwayman's tale is one of escape and survival, painted with strokes of desperation and grim resolve. Escaping from incarceration during a prison riot, he sought refuge in the underbelly of the city, subsisting in conditions that stripped away his illusions of freedom. A final job, taken out of sheer necessity, ended in tragedy, leaving him with a burden of guilt that no distance can alleviate.
highwayman.summary: A rugged, desperate, and remorseful Highwayman, haunted by his past as a fugitive, who cheats at cards and possesses a cynical gallows humor.

status.description: Guardedly alert, his cynicism warring with reluctant hope as he watches the Heiress stake her claim

clothing.head: Red scarf
clothing.body: Rugged grey coat with fur collar

notes: Known to cheat at cards
Has a gallows sense of humor
Carries a tarnished locket taken from a past victim as a reminder of his sins
Recognizes ambush tactics from his own past as a highwayman
Offers comfort to those struggling with violence, perhaps seeking to redeem his own bloody past through small kindnesses
Recognizes brigand tactics intimately, having once been the predator waiting in treelines

heiress.description: The Heiress's unflinching acceptance of blame and promise to die fighting has cracked his cynicism, though her sincerity worries him more than empty promises would.

kheir.description: The Highwayman has begun offering small kindnesses to the trembling Heir, perhaps seeing in the scholar's fear an echo of victims from his own darker days.

crusader.description: The wordless coordination between them in crisis confirms a kinship forged in violence—two men who read the same danger signs and move to counter them without needing to speak, their shared criminal and martial pasts creating an instinctive tactical partnership.

heiress.title: Heiress
heiress.name: Persephone
heiress.description: The Heiress to the accursed Estate, excels at taking command in even the most daunting situations. With her sharp intellect and strategic prowess, she fearlessly leads the charge to reclaim her ancestral home while deftly managing the nearby hamlet. Her natural authority and decisive leadership serve as a beacon of strength for a community besieged by supernatural horrors. Though grateful for allies brave enough to join her cause, Persephone's unwavering confidence in her own judgment can manifest as stubborn resistance when her authority is challenged.
heiress.history: Upon receiving a chilling letter from her late ancestor, the Heiress left her academic pursuits with her brother in tow to take up her role as the Heiress of the Estate. She found herself thrust into a nightmarish reality where her ancestral home was not only physically deteriorated but also infested with the horrors summoned by her ancestor's dark rituals.
heiress.summary: The decisive Heiress, a strategic and authoritative leader who struggles with stubbornness and anxiety about losing control, often resorting to wine.

status.description: Resolute and commanding despite her wounds, drawing strength from the weight of public declaration

appearance.hairStyle: Tied up in a bun and with curly bangs

clothing.head: Hair needle
clothing.body: Marine blue robe over white shirt

notes: Turns to wine when overwhelmed by stress
Attracted to, and can't help staring at, women with ample breasts
Scared of losing her authority, she meets those challenging it by becoming more commanding and inflexible.
Responds to sexualized threats with cold, controlled violence rather than visible distress
Refuses to let others tend her wounds, wearing injuries as proof of survival
Wears her wounds publicly as proof of commitment, refusing to appear untouched by hardship

kheir.description: The Heiress's protective instincts toward her brother have curdled into open contempt, her frustration with his visible cowardice manifesting as cutting public humiliation even as she shields him from harm.

crusader.description: The heiress maintains a reserved, professional demeanor towards the crusader, her latest recruit.

highwayman.description: The Heiress recognizes the Highwayman's value as a skilled fighter and tracker, though his criminal background requires she remain watchful. She hired him for competence, not trustworthiness.

hqclaimants.description: The Heiress saw the Claimants as vain and insufferable during their fleeting courtly encounters. Their thinly veiled insults ensured no love was lost between them.

duchess.description: The Heiress remembers the Duchess as aloof and self-absorbed during the few balls they attended together. Though she barely knew her, the Duchess's pride left a sour impression.

kheir.title: Heir
kheir.name: Percival
kheir.description: The Heir to the estate is a brilliant scholar and capable manager who is trying to cope in this world of horrors far beyond his comfort. Despite his meek nature, Percival's keen intellect and organizational skills prove invaluable in coordinating the chaotic efforts to reclaim his ancestral home. Though he prefers the map room, he, armed with a letter opener, reluctantly ventures into the dungeons when the quest demands it, determined to live up to the expectations of his Sister and their family name.
kheir.history: Raised in academic circles far from the estate's dark legacy, Percival initially resisted his sister's summons. However, his sense of duty—and intellectual curiosity—ultimately drew him to the task. While he makes no pretense of physical courage, he is the backbone of the estate's logistics, handling its people with the same ease he manages its resources.
kheir.summary: The meek, cowardly Heir, a brilliant scholar with a drinking problem, who struggles to cope with horrors and is very possessive of his belongings.

status.description: Nauseated by the weight of his sister's declarations that include him, feeling like a fraud beside her commanding presence

notes: Obsessively protective of his personal belongings.
Has a penchant for fine wines to calm his nerves.
Can be argumentative and sharp when in his element, but becomes quieter and withdrawn when frightened.
Harbors shameful satisfaction when his sister suffers, a dark impulse that disgusts him
Silently resents being included in promises he doubts he can keep

heiress.description: His sister's bold declarations on his behalf deepen his sense of inadequacy, breeding quiet resentment even as he remains utterly reliant on her leadership.

crusader.description: The Heir is intimidated by the Crusader's imposing presence and martial bearing, but finds some comfort in having such a formidable protector.

highwayman.description: The Highwayman's steady presence offers the Heir a rare kindness amid his terror, becoming an unlikely source of comfort that his own sister fails to provide.

hqclaimants.description: The Claimants' constant disdain and biting remarks left a lasting impression on the Heir during the balls and duels of their youth. The Heir remains embittered but grudgingly acknowledges The Claimant brother's skill with a spear.

duchess.description: As a young man, the Heir was captivated by the Duchess' elegance and fencing prowess. Though their interactions were brief and unreciprocated, her image lingered in his mind for years.

kheir.entry: Arrived at the ancestral hamlet for the first time, confronting the grim reality of his inheritance.

heiress.entry: Publicly accepted responsibility for the ancestral sins that devastated the hamlet, pledging to fight or die alongside its people.

estateLogs.entry: The party traveled by stagecoach through the oppressive Weald toward the ancestral estate, tensions simmering beneath nervous conversation.
The carriage crashed in the woods, leaving the party stranded. The driver and horses vanished without trace, forcing the group to proceed on foot toward the hamlet.
A cutthroat brigand emerged to block the party's path after their stagecoach was overturned, threatening violence while his unseen allies lurked in the treeline.

The party discovered a ransacked merchant camp with days-old corpses before being confronted by two brigands—a scarred giant with a cat o' nine tails and a hooded man with a blunderbuss—blocking the road to the hamlet.
The party arrived at the hamlet after surviving the brigand ambush, where the Caretaker awaited them with the stagecoach, speaking cryptically of the Estate's awareness of their coming.
The Drammingford heirs publicly announced their arrival to the hamlet, with Persephone claiming responsibility for their ancestor's sins and pledging to fight alongside the townsfolk.
